instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3126: What is 820-3126? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: I recived this iMac with no video. With new working video card no video. 4 leds are on. I checked L9000 and it is ok. Something more I can check on the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: All 4 LEDs means the LDC is getting power and there should be an image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: So, next step is to try with another screen ot lvds cable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3126</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: No, you try an external monitor to make sure there is video.
